application

Class ToClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • application.TCP
        • application.ToClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ToClient
extends TCP
    Represents the connection between the client and the chat server. Extends class TCP.
    Author:
    Fredrik Johansson, Mattias Edin

    • Constructor Detail

      • ToClient

        public ToClient(java.net.Socket socket)
         throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                java.io.IOException
        Constructor for class ToClient, extends TCP. Calls the super class with received parameters.
        Parameters:
        socket - The socket to witch the connection has been established.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - Thrown to indicate that the IP address of a host could not be determined.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

    • Method Detail

      • receive

        public void receive(byte[] bytes,
           int bytesRead)
        Overrides the abstract method receive of the class TCP. When the TCP connection receives a package it sends it's content to this this method. Depending on the OpCode contained in the package this method executes different actions.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The received bytes.
        bytesRead - Number of bytes read.

        Returns A string representation of this thread, including the thread's name, priority, and thread group.

      • disconnectTCP

        public void disconnectTCP()
        Overrides an abstract method of TCP. This method is invoked if a client quits without a quit message.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Overrides an abstract method of TCP. This method is invoked if a client quits with a quit message, or when the server shuts down and disconnects all clients.
        Specified by:
        disconnect in class TCP

      • sendPDU

        public void sendPDU(PDU pdu)
        Sends a PDU to the connected client through the class TCP witch is using the TCP protocol.
        Parameters:
        pdu - Package to send.
